The Ministry of External Relations hereb: The Ministry of External Relations hereby informs the public that the ONLY sites dedicated to online visa applications are: www.evisacam.cm or www.evisacam.com. Cameroon For any difficulty related to the visa issuance procedure, contact our services at the address: contact@evisacam.cm The Ministry of External Relations declines its responsibility for any action carried out outside the aforementioned sites.
To make your future stay abroad a pleasa: To make your future stay abroad a pleasant one, the first step is to prepare for it with complete peace of mind.This means:
Apply for a visa as soon as you have def: Apply for a visa as soon as you have defined your travel plans
Make all your bookings in advance(flight: Make all your bookings in advance(flight ticket, accomodation, etc..)
ATTACH all eligible documents to ensure: ATTACH all eligible documents to ensure that your application is processed within the statutory deadlines.
Applying for a visa is not just a formal: Applying for a visa is not just a formality. A requested visa may be granted or denied after studying the applicant's file. You are strongly advised to include flight and accommodation bookings in your application, and to confirm these bookings only after you have received your visa.

Cameroon, officially the Republic of Cam: Cameroon, officially the Republic of Cameroon (French:République du Cameroun), is a country in Central Africa.
It shares boundaries with Nigeria to the: It shares boundaries with Nigeria to the west and north, Chad to the northeast, the Central African Republic to the east, and Equatorial Guinea, Gabon and the Republic of the Congo to the south. Its coastline lies on the Bight of Biafra, part of the Gulf of Guinea and the Atlantic Ocean. Due to its strategic position at the crossroads between West Africa and Central Africa, it has been categorized as being in both camps. Its nearly 27 million people speak 250 native languages and English or French or both.
